meanings.definition: Tonsured: having the hair on the scalp shaved or cut close to the skin, especially as a religious practice.
meanings.sent1: The monk with the tonsured head prayed silently in the chapel.
meanings.sent2: In the monastery, the tonsured priests gathered for evening prayers.
meanings.sent3: The tonsured man chuckled as he felt the breeze on his freshly shaved head.
meanings.sent4: Her tonsured appearance gave her an aura of serenity and devotion.
meanings.sent5: The tonsured look of the monks was a symbol of their dedication to God.

meanings.definition: Tonsured: to shave or cut the hair on the scalp close to the skin, especially as a religious practice.
meanings.sent1: The barber carefully tonsured the young man's hair for his ordination ceremony.
meanings.sent2: During the ritual, the priest tonsured the novice as a sign of initiation.
meanings.sent3: She decided to tonsure her hair to show solidarity with the monks.
meanings.sent4: The act of tonsuring symbolized a new beginning for the devotee.
meanings.sent5: The tradition of tonsuring has been passed down for generations in the monastery.
